verses.verse: I exhort the elders who are among you. I also am an elder, an eyewitness of the sufferings of Christ, and a partaker of the glory that will be revealed.
Feed the flock of God, which is among you. Take the oversight voluntarily, not by being forced, not for money's sake but with a willingly heart.
Do not lord it over God's heritage, but be examples to the flock.
When the Chief Shepherd will appear, you will receive a crown of glory that does not fade away.
Likewise, you younger ones yield to the elder's counsel. Yes, all be yielding to one another and be clothed with humility, for God resists the proud and gives grace to the humble.
So humble yourselves under God's mighty hand, so he may lift you up at the proper time.
Cast all your worries on him, because he cares for you.
Be clear headed; be vigilant, because your enemy, the devil, like a roaring lion, walks around seeking whom he can devour.
Resist him, [be] immovable in the faith, realizing that the same kind of afflictions are being faced by your brothers who are in the world.
But the God of all grace, who has called us into his eternal glory by Christ Jesus, will mend you, make you resolute, give you strength, and support you.
To him [be] glory and supremacy forever and ever. Amen.

I have written briefly to you with the help of Silvanus whom I regard as a faithful brother. [I have written] encouraging [you] and testifying that this is the true grace of God in which you firmly stand.
The [church] at Babylon, chosen together with [you] sends you greetings and Mark, my son, also.
Greet one another with a kiss of love. May peace [be] with you all who are Christ Jesus'. Amen.
